FuncDef:
The ds-lite log send-mode command configures the mode of sending DS-Lite logs.
The undo ds-lite log send-mode command restores the default configuration.
By default, logs are sent when a DS-Lite session is created and when a DS-Lite session ages out.
CLIs: undo ds-lite log send-mode { session-start-only | session-end-only }

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that logs are sent only when a DS-Lite session is created.
-

Indicates that logs are sent only when a DS-Lite session ages out.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By default, logs are sent when a DS-Lite session is created and when a DS-Lite session ages out. To allow logs to be sent only when a DS-Lite session is created or ages out so that the number of DS-Lite logs is reduced, run the log send-mode command.
Precaution
This command takes effect only after the DS-Lite log function is enabled on a DS-Lite instance.
If the session-start-only parameter is specified, logs are sent only when a DS-Lite session is created. In this case, the DS-Lite session aging time cannot be specified after a DS-Lite session ages out.
If the session-end-only parameter is specified, logs are sent only when a DS-Lite session ages out. In this case, information about the DS-Lite session is not displayed on the log server before the DS-Lite session ages out. If the DS-Lite session keeps not aging out (traffic always exists), information about the DS-Lite session will never be displayed on the log server. If the board is reset, log tracing fails.
